description.narrative: By 2016, identified beneficiaries are covered with social health insurance and benefit equitably from increased access to sustainable, quality and integrated basic MNCH services.

mailing-address.narrative: No. 81 A Tran Quoc Toan Ha Noi Viet Nam

sector.narrative: Community and home based maternal and newborn care
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development
Technical assistance - Maternal and newborn health

title.narrative: Vietnam Programme Strategy Note Theory of Change
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2018 Vietnam: Evaluation of UNICEF Viet Nam Rural Sanitation and Hygiene Programme (RSHP) 2012 – 2016

2018 Vietnam: External After Action Review of the Government of Viet Nam and UNICEF emergency response supporting children and women in 10 provinces in Viet Nam affected by drought and salt water intrusion crisis (2016-2017)
Viet Nam 2019 Annual Report on Results for Children
Vietnam Country Office 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, identified beneficiaries are covered with social health insurance and benefit equitably from increased access to sustainable, quality and integrated basic MNCH services.

description.narrative: With UNICEF's technical and financial support the Government institutionalized and scaled up skilled birth attendants, early essential newborn care, kangaroo mother care and immunization coverage in hard-to-reach areas through creating an enabling environment and providing capacity building. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Existence of a Multi-Year Plan (MYP) for immunisation

actual.value: 2016:Ministry of Health has a Multi-Year Plan (MYP) for immunisation

title.narrative: Availability of new MoH policy, strategies and guidelines available for improving healthcare services for pregnant women, mothers, new-born children, and children under six, including specific measures for the benefit of vulnerable groups

actual.value: 2014:An inter-ministerial circular, 24/2014 complimenting circular 09/2009 and guiding implementation of health insurance, is issued by Government. The Prime Minister's Decision on specific policies on health care for poor and ethnic minority women is submitted for approval. Two national guidelines on

target.value: 2016:Available [Supplementary targets: Policy and planning advice for the upcoming national target plan provided by 2016, MoH initiated the review process and prepared concept notes against various WASH th

actual.value:
2014:Viet Nam committed to eliminate open defecation in Sanitation and Water for All partnership by targeting poorest. Latest approaches to programming include community approaches to total sanitation (CATS) using community mobilization and low-cost option promotion.
Development of the post 2015 program

title.narrative: Availability of a list of indicators for MNCH and data collection tools included in revised national Health Management Information System (HMIS) that is more integrated, more harmonised, and in line with international standards

baseline.value: Not available [Vertical health indicators for maternal program, nutrition program, immunization program exist but the system is excessive in the data collection demand and badly organised leading to p

actual.value: 2014:Circular -06/2014 is issued on health information system strengthening with a list of 88 national key healthcare indicators. The list including indicators on maternal and child health has been issued and disseminated for nationwide implementation.
